citation.article-title: Two new genera of nocardioform actinomycetes; Amycolata gen. nov. and Amycolatopsis gen. nov.

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis rugosa (ex di Marco and Spalla 1957) sp. nov.
Amycolatopsis rugosa (ru.go'sa. L. adj. rugosa wrinkled)
Aerial mycelium lacking.
Vegetative hyphae fragment rapidly (24 to 48 h) on rich media.
Some soluble brownish pigments formed on some media.
Casein, hypoxanthine, xanthine, and tyrosine decomposed.
Gelatinase, urease, and nitrate reductase positive.
Esculin hydrolyzed.
Phosphatase produced.
Lysozyme sensitive.
Acetate, benzoate, lactate, malate, propionate, pyruvate, and succinate decarboxylated.
Acid produced from adonitol, arabinose, erythritol, fructose, galactose, glucose, glycerol, mannitol, mannose, rhamnose, salicin, trehalose, and xylose, Grows on 5% NaCl and at 10 to 45°C.
No growth at 50°C or in salicylate broth.
No decomposition of adenine or starch.
No decarboxylation of citrate, mucate, oxalate, or tartrate.
No acid produced from cellobiose, dextrin, dulcitol, inositol, maltose, melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, raffinose, sorbitol, sucrose, or β-methyl-D-xyloside.
The carbohydrate utilization pattern is shown in Table 4.
The principal menaquinones are MK-9 (H2, H4).
Produces vitamin B12.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 68.9 mol% (Tm method).
The type strain is strain ATCC 43014 (= IMRU 3760).
